citation.article-title: Methylobacterium bullatum sp. nov., a methylotrophic bacterium isolated from Funaria hygrometrica

p.s: Description of Methylobacterium bullatum sp. nov.

id="par0100">Methylobacterium bullatum (F3.2T) (=DSM 21893T = LMG 24788T) (bul.la’tum. L. neut. adj. bullatum, furnished with a boss or stud, equipped with an adorned surface) was isolated from Funaria hygrometrica. The type strain is Methylobacterium bullatum (F3.2) (=DSM 21893T = LMG 24788T).
id="par0105">Cells of Methylobacterium bullatum sp. nov. are Gram-stain-negative rods (0.6–1.3 μm × 1.3–3.3 μm), rarely branched or pleomorphic, occurring singly, in pairs or in aggregates.
They are motile by a polar to subpolar flagellum in the liquid phase of the medium.
They always contain polyhydroxybutyrate granules (PHB) and sometimes polyphosphate granules [24].
They are strictly aerobic, catalase and oxidase positive.
id="par0110">Cells of this species show a polymorphic cell surface with short appendages.
Colonies grown on GP agar for seven days are about 1.8 mm in diameter.
They could be described as smooth, circular, regular-edged, shiny and red coloured.
The red pigment of the cells is water-insoluble.
Growth occurs at 10–33 °C (optimum at 28 °C).
There exists a pH tolerance at 5.5–8.0 (optimum: 6.5–7.0 at 28 °C) and a NaCl-tolerance of 0.6%.
Cells of this species are biofilm-producers.
Methyl red and Voges–Proskauer test are negative.
Indole and H2S are not produced and nitrate is reduced neither to nitrite nor to N2.
Urease activity is positive, but β-galactosidase, l-arginin dihydrolase and β-glucosidase activity are not apparent.
id="par0115">Starch, gelatine and Tween 80 are not hydrolysed.
Strain F3.2T produces the hormone auxin (IAA) and siderophores.
Ammonium chloride, ammonium sulfate, potassium nitrate, sodium nitrate, glutamate and urea are utilized as sole nitrogen sources.
id="par0120">The major cellular fatty acids of M. bullatum sp. nov. are C18:1ω7c (81.7%) and summed feature C16:1ω7c and/or iso-C15:02OH (11.7%) (Table 1).

id="par0125">Strain F3.2T produces acid from glycerol, d-arabinose and d-fructose but not from d-glucose, saccharose, lactose, maltose, d-xylose, ammonium acetate, sodium citrate (variable) and sodium glutamate glycerol (variable).
id="par0130">Different compounds serving as the sole carbon and energy sources were tested and the results are shown in Table S2, also with the remaining carbon sources of the API 50CH test stripes.
The G + C content of the DNA is 67.1 mol%.
F3.2T contains a cryptic plasmid with a size of 43 ± 1 kb, designated pFL110.
